briefTitle: Aspirin for Exercise in Multiple Sclerosis (ASPIRE)
officialTitle: Aspirin for Exercise in Multiple Sclerosis (ASPIRE): A Double-Blind RCT of Aspirin or Acetaminophen Pretreatment to Improve Exercise Performance in Multiple Sclerosis (MS)
summary: This study investigates the use of aspirin as an exercise pre-treatment to reduce overheating and exhaustion, which may potentially allow many more people with multiple sclerosis to participate in and benefit from exercise. The design is double-blind, within-subject, with three arms: participants will receive one of three treatments at three separate study visits: aspirin, acetaminophen, and placebo, followed by completion of a maximal exercise test.

primaryOutcome.timeFrame: from start of exercise test until self-reported exhaustion, up to 30 minutes
